title: Madhya Pradesh High Court bans burning of Meghalaya honeymoon murder accused Sonam Raghuvanshi's effigy on Dasara
content: 'Paurush', an Indore-based social organisation, said it was preparing an 11-headed effigy for ‘Surpanakha dahan’, which will feature images of women accused of heinous murders of their husbands, children, or in-laws

title: PM Modi to release postal stamp and coin to mark Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh’s centenary year
content: RSS, the ideological parent of ruling BJP, is completing its 100th year on the day of Vijayadashami falling on October 2, 2025 this year

title: Madras High Court to hear case against TVK at 4.30 p.m. today

title: Dharma has kept India united: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan in Bihar

title: Karnataka government empowered 1.2 lakh women, provided financial assistance of ₹50,000 crore in last two years: Shalini Rajneesh

title: AIADMK reschedules Palaniswami’s campaign in Dharmapuri, Namakkal districts
content: As per the revised itinerary, Mr. Palaniswami will campaign in the Dharmapuri, Pappireddipatti, and Harur Assembly constituencies on October 2

title: Trawler capsizes off Goa coast; all 27 fishermen rescued

title: Watch: Asia Cup final | Looking back at India’s record against Pakistan in tournament finals
content: India and Pakistan will play each other in an Asia Cup final for the first time, on September 28. The teams played each other twice in the tournament, with India winning both easily. We look back at previous tournament finals in limited-overs cricket between these two sides in series involving five or more teams.

title: Maharashtra rains: Devendra Fadnavis reviews relief operations, urges evacuation in vulnerable areas

title: Public-private-partnership project launched at Cherlapalli Prison Agriculture Colony in Telangana

title: One person killed in Belagavi road accident

title: Mann ki Baat: ‘We have to become self-reliant’ says PM Modi, urges Indians to buy Swadeshi

title: Warning of heavy rainfall in Konkan, Central Maharashtra, Marathwada till September 30
content: State Emergency Operations Centre issues instructions to all district administrations in view of the potential heavy rainfall

content: While the data reflects a significant shift in the age of marriage in urban areas, there is still considerable room for improvement in rural areas

title: We deliver babies, clean health-care centres, in just ₹3,000 per month: Maharashtra’s part-time women attendants demand justice

title: Karur stampede: No words of comfort can truly ease the pain of losing loved ones, says TVK chief Vijay
content: Actor Vijay prayed for the speedy recovery of all the injured and assured that his party would extend full support to those undergoing treatment

content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asserted that Assam will continue identifying infiltrators and sending them back.

title: Punjab farmers have 'lost faith' in AAP govt, want flood-related compensation: Union Minister B.L. Verma
content: The Punjab Government has been claiming that the Centre has not yet released any money out of the ₹1,600 crore relief package announced by the PM.

title: Six militants arrested in Manipur, including three from banned PLA outfit
content: Police also arrested a woman cadre of the proscribed National Revolutionary Front of Manipur (NRFM) outfit in Imphal East district.

title: Suspected drone movement along International Border in J&K’s Samba
content: The Pakistani drone was reportedly noticed hovering over village Karalian in Ramgarh sector at 6.30 a.m. before disappearing, the officials said

title: Three persons killed in two different road accidents in Virudhunagar district
content: The police said two persons, including a boy, were killed when a speeding truck rammed against a roadside meat shop at Kamaraj Nagar in Dhalavaipuram

title: Curfew remains in force for fifth day in Leh town

content: Recently, at an all India programme of hotel sector held in Bengaluru, APHA president Srinivasa Rao submitted a memorandum to Minister Kandula Durgesh

content: The award was presented at a function organised by Andhra Pradesh Government on the occasion of World Tourism Day in Vijayawada

content: The Commission is expected to visit Karur this afternoon and start the probe, the Deputy Chief Minister said.

title: Andhra Pradesh DISCOMs to refund ‘true-down’ charges amounting to ₹924 crore to retail consumers
content: An APERC release said it was the first time since the Commission’s formation in 1999 that the payment of ‘true-down’ amounts had been ordered

title: News in Frames: From skies above to shores below

title: The Hindu FIC to hold awareness programme on heart health in Vijayawada on September 29
content: The initiative to be held at Heart and Brain Institute of Andhra Hospitals aims to educate people on maintaining a healthy heart through lifestyle choices, timely diagnosis, and preventive care

title: Vijayawada to help five smaller cities achieve cleanliness goals
content: Under the ‘Swachh City Jodi’ initiative, Vijayawada has been designated as the mentor for Narsapur, Samarlakota, Akividu, Chintalapudi, and Gollaprolu

title: Heavy rains soak Mumbai overnight; IMD forecasts more showers
content: Local train services of the Central Railway and Western Railway were running with some delays, while buses of the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) undertaking were plying without any diversion

title: TVK rally stampede: T.N. BJP president Nainar Nagenthran seeks probe by SC bench
content: Nagenthran paid respects to the dead and calling on the injured at the Karur Government Medical College Hospital along with senior party leaders Tamilisai Soundararjan and Pon. Radhakrishnan

title: Rains LIVE: IMD issues ‘red alert’ for extremely heavy rainfall in Mumbai
content: About 1,500 people living in low-lying areas here were shifted to relief camps as the Musi river was in spate following heavy rains in the city, officials said on September 27

title: TVK rally stampede: Shortcomings in security arrangements led to loss of lives in Karur, alleges Palaniswami
content: Referring to Mr. Vijay’s remarks at the rally questioning the arrival of ambulances at the venue, Mr. Palaniswami said such comments “raise suspicion”

title: Is Alabama back? Is Oregon the Big Ten's best? A raucous Week 5 reshuffled expectations
content: With four top-10 teams losing, Week 5 offered a reminder of just how little we know so early in a season.

title: Ducks' Moore breaks through in 2OT upset of PSU
content: Oregon coach Dan Lanning touted Dante Moore as the best quarterback in the nation after his poised performance led the Ducks to a 30-24 double-overtime win over Penn State.

title: Franklin takes 'ownership' of PSU loss to Ducks
content: Coach James Franklin, quarterback Drew Allar and the rest of the No. 3 Penn State Nittany Lions lost yet another game to a top-10 opponent Saturday night, as the No. 6 Oregon Ducks posted a thrilling 30-24 victory in double overtime at Beaver Stadium.

title: Bama upsets UGA, showing 'fight' after early loss
content: Alabama held on to beat No. 5 Georgia 24-21, handing the Bulldogs their first home loss in six years.

title: Europe holds historic lead, on brink of Ryder Cup
content: Europe is on the verge of retaining the Ryder Cup after a dominant Saturday left it just 2.5 points from victory over the United States at Bethpage Black.

title: Bryson, Rose, caddies get heated at Bethpage
content: The caddies for Bryson DeChambeau and Scottie Scheffler were involved in a confrontation with Europe's Justin Rose and Tommy Fleetwood during their four-ball match Saturday.

title: Kiffin's 'little, short' QB leads Rebels past LSU
content: Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss, who didn't receive any Division I scholarships coming out of high school, helped the Rebels orchestrate a thrilling 24-19 victory over No. 4 LSU on Saturday afternoon, keeping Lane Kiffin's team unbeaten at 5-0.

title: Lynx's Reeve suspended after blasting officiating
content: The WNBA suspended Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve for Sunday's Game 4 vs. the Mercury after her "conduct and comments" during and after Friday's Game 3 loss.

title: Guardians clinch playoff berth on walk-off HBP
content: The Guardians clinched a playoff berth Saturday night after CJ Kayfus was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded in the ninth inning.

title: 'Down geauxs LSU': Ole Miss headlines top trolls from college football Week 5

content: Napheesa Collier got hurt. Cheryl Reeve got ejected. Phoenix took a 2-1 lead. What does it mean for the semifinals?

title: Atletico Madrid's big win over work-in-progress Real should kick-start their season
content: All it takes sometimes is one game to transform a season. For Atletico Madrid, Saturday's huge 5-2 win over rivals Real should do that for Diego Simeone's side.

title: Liverpool had better learn from dramatic late defeat at unbeaten Crystal Palace
content: After weeks of winning late, on Saturday Liverpool tasted defeat at Crystal Palace with the final kick of the game. The result won't wreck the Reds, but it will give them something to think about.

content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

title: ✍ Regular-season grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: 🏀 Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: 🏈 Oklahoma St. fires longtime coach Mike Gundy
content: Oklahoma State, which has lost 11 of 12 games since the start of the 2024 season, has fired head coach Mike Gundy, who was in his 21st season with the Cowboys.

title: ↔️ Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent NFL trades
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

content: The NFL went international in Week 4. Here's how Minnesota and Pittsburgh made the trip worth remembering in Dublin.

title: From The Big Dumper to ... magic? Why Mariners might have the mojo to finally win it all
content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Man United eye cut-priced Vlahovic
content: Chelsea and Manchester United will try to sign Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury take 2-1 lead over Lynx, Aces up 2-1 over Fever
content: In the 2025 WNBA semifinals, Phoenix leads 1-seed Minnesota 2-1 while Las Vegas is up 2-1 over Indiana.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

content: Whether in a redraft or dynasty league, here are the rookies you need to know before your fantasy hockey draft.

title: 'US Will Have To Fix India': Top Trump Aide Amid Tariff Tensions
content: The United States will have to "fix" a bunch of countries, including India, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has said.

title: Heavy Overnight Rain In Mumbai, Local Trains See Delays, No Bus Diversions
content: Parts of south Mumbai received more than 100 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: 10 Minors Among Victims Of Stampede At Actor Vijay's Rally, Youngest Was 2
content: At least 10 minors, including a two-year-old, are among the 39 victims of the stampede at actor-politician Vijay's rally in Karur yesterday. Many of them are women and most victims are in their 20s and 30s, NDTV has found.

title: Who Is Ian Roberts, Ex-Olympian And School Superintendent Arrested By US Immigration Authorities
content: Ian Roberts is a seasoned educator and former Olympian, having competed in track and field at the 2000 Sydney Games and World Championships.

title: Delhi Baba's Fraud Exposed: Forged UN Visiting Cards, Faked PMO Connection
content: Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, who was arrested for sexually harassing 17 women at an ashram in Delhi, has been exposed for many fraudulent activities, including forging visiting cards and passports.

title: 6 Insurgents, Including 3 From People's Liberation Army, Arrested In Manipur
content: Six militants belonging to different banned outfits have been arrested from three Imphal Valley districts of Manipur, police said on Sunday.

title: Actor Vijay's Chennai Home Fortified, Government Sources Cite 'Public Anger'
content: Security has been stepped up at actor-politician Vijay's residence in Chennai after a stampede at his rally in Karur left 39 dead and over a 100 injured, sources in the Tamil Nadu government have said.

title: What Is 'Clog The Toilet' Racist Campaign Against Indian H-1B Holders
content: After Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas, panic spread among Indian tech workers, who scrambled to return to the US.

title: This Racist Campaign Seeks To Block Indian H-1B Visa Holders Rushing To US
content: The US awards 85,000 H-1B visas per year on a lottery system, with India accounting for around three-quarters of the recipients.

title: 'Unbearable Loss': Actor Vijay To Give 20 Lakh To Stampede Victims' Families
content: Superstar Vijay announces Rs 20 lakh assistance for families of stampede victims, Rs 2 lakh for injured

title: Iran's Clerical Leaders Face Existential Crisis After UN Sanctions
content: The UN reimposed sanctions on Iran after last-ditch talks between Tehran and European powers failed to resolve the latest of decades of standoffs over Iran's nuclear program.

title: What Haryana Police Said On Theft At Mary Kom's Faridabad Home
content: The Haryana Police said on Sunday that a crime branch team has arrived at the residence of the Indian boxer Mary Kom and is investigating the matter.

title: Trump To Send Troops To Portland, Oregon In Latest Deployment To US Cities
content: President Donald Trump said Saturday that he will send troops to Portland, "authorizing Full Force, if necessary" to handle "domestic terrorists" as he expands his deployments to more American cities.

title: 16-Month-Old Girl Falls Into Boiled Milk, Dies Of Burns In Andhra Pradesh
content: A 16-month-old girl died after accidentally falling into a vessel of boiled milk at a Gurukul school in Korrapadu village of Anantapur district, said police on Sunday.

title: The Stampede Aftermath: Shoes, Garbage Scattered At Actor Vijay's Rally
content: Mounds of shoes and chappals, crushed water bottles, torn party flags, pieces of clothes, broken poles, shreds of paper sprayed from party poppers and striking garbage of sorts.

title: Who Is Justice Aruna Jagadeesan Set To Probe Actor Vijay's Rally Stampede
content: At least 39 people were killed and nearly 100 others injured in a stampede at a political rally held by Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) in Karur.

title: India Calls For End To Hostilities In Ukraine, Gaza, Offers Help To Restore Peace: S Jaishankar
content: Addressing world leaders from the iconic podium in the UN General Assembly hall, S Jaishankar said that nations who can engage all sides must "step-up in the search for solutions".

title: Economic Ties With India Not Under Threat Due To Tariffs: Russian Minister
content: At the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov asserted that the economic partnership between India and Russia is "not under threat" amid the US tariffs on India for buying Russian oil.

title: Teen Rescued 6 Months After She Was Kidnapped, Raped Multiple Times In UP
content: A 16-year-old girl was was rescued allegedly after she was kidnapped, kept hostage for six months and raped multiple times over the period, police said on Saturday.

title: Watch: India’s renewables push is incomplete; here’s why: the storage challenge
content: Battery energy storage systems are key to balancing India’s growing renewable power. But limited manufacturing, high costs, and lithium import dependence raise big questions about India’s clean energy future.

title: Karur stampede: Crowd mismanagement, lack of amenities worsened the tragedy, say locals
content: Several locals said the choice of venue aggravated the situation; others pointed to the absence of basic amenities

title: In Pictures: Stampede at Vijay’s TVK rally in Karur
content: A stream of ambulances pours into Karur hospitals carrying the injured; Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces ₹10 lakh to the next of kin of the deceased and ₹1 lakh for the injured; retired judge to head probe commission

title: Karur stampede: Commission of Inquiry will unravel circumstances that led to the tragedy, says CM Stalin
content: To a question on whether Mr. Vijay would be arrested in connection with the tragedy, Mr. Stalin said it would all depend on the findings of the report

title: India, Pakistan Spar at UN General Assembly over terrorism, Pahalgam attack
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had, in his UNGA statement, accused Pakistan, without naming the country, of being a hub of terrorism

title: India's Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve designated by UNESCO
content: With the latest addition, India has 13 biospheres listed in UNESCO’s World Network of Biosphere Reserves (WNBR)

title: Dugong redux
content: A multi-stakeholder conservation project in the waters of the Palk Bay has resulted in a rise in the number of dugongs, once dwindling in the area. S. Ganesan and R. Rajaram examine what measures facilitated the return of these sea cows, and what more needs to be done, even as international recognition comes Tamil Nadu’s way

title: In Kolkata, poetry and art from Gaza and Bengal famine converge in Durga Puja pandal
content: Artist Pradip Das explores parallels between poems from the Gaza strip and the depictions of hunger and death in Bengali poetry on the famine; they are connected, despite being several kilometres and years apart, he says

title: Elephants in fragmented habitats of South Bengal record higher levels of stress, reveals study
content: Elephants living in more fragmented habitats in central India, particularly South Bengal have recorded higher adrenal activity to cope with the stress.

title: Karur TVK secretary booked over stampede at Vijay’s rally
content: Police said the case was filed under sections 109, 110, 125b, 223 of BNS for alleged violation of norms during the campaign event at Velysamupuram.

title: The crucial issue behind Wangchuk’s detention is whether his acts prejudiced ‘public order’
content: The Supreme Court has differentiated between breach of ‘law and order’ and violation of ‘public order’; the latter refers to actions which affect the community or the public at large

title: What does Trump’s latest H-1B directive state? | Explained
content: What will be the consequences for both American and immigrant workers? Do overseas workers displace Americans in tech jobs? What do surveys show? What are immigration lawyers saying? What are the trends likely to play out in the tech sector?

content: What led to the violence? What are the protesters’ demands? Why has activist Sonam Wangchuk been arrested?

title: Political mudslinging on social media adds to cyber police’s burden
content: While the latest such case registered over a complaint by CPI(M) leader K.J. Shine has grabbed wider attention, FIRs registered this year show that the cyber wing of the Kochi City police has been dealing with more complaints involving politicians

title: President Murmu, Union Ministers Rajnath Singh and Amit Shah, and others condole deaths at TVK rally in Karur
content: T.N. leader, including Edappadi K. Palaniswami, P. Shanmugam, and Anbumani Ramadoss, call for probe into the incident

title: UN is gridlocked and needs reform, says Jaishankar at United Nations General Assembly
content: External Affairs Minister calls for the expansion of both permanent and non-permanent membership to the United Nations Security Council; India is ready to assume greater responsibilities, he adds

title: Palaniswami urges Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to release white paper on T.N.’s financial position
content: He alleges that the DMK government has so far availed itself of market borrowings to the tune of ₹4.50 lakh crore

title: Watch: Vijay’s Karur rally turns deadly: 36 killed in stampede, probe ordered
content: A tragic stampede at actor-politician Vijay’s rally in Karur claimed at least 36 lives, including women and children, and left over 50 injured. The overcrowded event was part of Vijay’s state-wide tour. CM M.K. Stalin called the incident deeply concerning, ordered emergency response, and announced ₹10 lakh compensation for the victims’ families.

title: Mohanlal | The legend next door
content: The veteran actor, who won the prestigious Dadasaheb Phalke award, redefined stardom in the Malayalam film industry and steered a new path in cinema by combining commercial elements with unique story-telling perspectives

title: Karur stampede: Anatomy of the tragedy at Vijay’s TVK rally in Tamil Nadu
content: The organisers had announced that TVK president Vijay would speak at 12 p.m.; the crowd began to assemble from 9 a.m., but he did not arrive at the scheduled time.

title: Govt. grants administrative sanction for construction of stretch between HMT, NAD
content: A review meeting convened by Industries Minister P. Rajeeve resolved to initiate tender formalities promptly upon receipt of technical sanction

title: Pre-cast technology being considered for restoration of remaining stretch of Mullassery canal
content: Minor Irrigation dept. is mulling over the possibility of using precast concrete structures to restore the 200-metre stretch between Chittoor Road and M.G. Road under ‘Operation Breakthrough’

title: Encroachments demolished to complete new bridge across Kamadalam river near Arani
content: Officials of State Highways, which is constructing the bridge, said that most of the encroachments are houses and petty shops, which were built more than two decades ago.

title: Officials yet to give a copy of detention order, no contact with Sonam Wangchuk, says his wife
content: Gitanjali Angmo says she will move court in a day if there is no information on the activist; two Congress councillors and several youth leaders surrender in court today

title: 10,000 homestay facilities will be ready across A.P. soon, says CM
content: Naidu releases Tourism Policy Operational Guidelines and launches ‘AP Tourism Homestay Portal’; government is eyeing tourism growth rate of 20%

title: Election Commission of India to visit Bihar next week to assess poll preparedness
content: As a practice, election dates are announced after the visit of the full ECI to a State; likely to be announced any time after October 5

title: Musi in spate: A flood to remember
content: ‘Current flood inflow to Osman Sagar and Himayatsagar matches levels last observed in 1962 and 1965’

title: CM Siddaramaiah pulls up civic officials over potholes and poor waste management
content: With potholes multiplying during the monsoon, the Chief Minister gave civic agencies a one-month deadline to repair roads and make them motorable

title: Maulana forgot whose government is in Uttar Pradesh, will teach a lesson generations will forget to riot, says Adityanath
content: A day after a demonstration on a cleric’s call took a violent turn leading to clashes with the police, the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister says “for such anti-social elements” who were getting a free run, “we have brought in the bulldozer”. He says since 2017, his government has dealt firmly with rioters, responding in ways they understand.

title: Graft has ‘doubled’ in some depts under Congress rule: Karnataka contractors’ association
content: For the first time since it came to power in the 2023 elections on an anti-corruption plank, the Congress government has received a written letter from the KSCA, alleging corruption in the ruling dispensation.

title: Media conference begins on Monday
content: CM to open International Media Festival of Kerala in State capital on Tuesday; Palestine solidarity conference to be held on Monday

title: Musi river in spate leaves behind a trail of destruction
content: Water enters 200-300 houses, and many are completely submerged. Many residents say they were not alerted about water release from two reservoirs. In the city’s main bus station, about 2,000 passengers were evacuated using ropes.

title: Holiday exodus adds to Bengaluru’s weekend snarls; commuters lament hour-long delays
content: The Central Business District and shopping hubs in the city centre were the worst affected, as traffic crawled along stretches such as M.G. Road, Brigade Road, Residency Road, Avenue Road, S.P. Road, and B.V.K. Iyengar Road

title: Karnataka Minister visits flood-hit Ganagapur, Sonna
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister and Kalaburagi district In charge Priyank Kharge on Friday visited Ganagapur, Sonna, and other areas that were hit by floods as a large volume of water has been released into the Bhima from Maharashtra’s Veer, Ujani, and Seena reservoirs and Bori river, triggering fears of flooding

title: Opposition slams U.P. govt. over Bareilly violence, alleges bid to divide society
content: Congress leaders say police action over ‘I Love Muhammad’ posters reflects strategy to cover failures and polarise communities

title: India will reject China’s ‘arrogance of power’, Manmohan Singh wrote in one of his last essays
content: The late former Prime Minister advised reassessment of India-China ties after 2020 Galwan clashes but urged India to expand trade ties with Asian neighbours, including China

title: Govt. college students boycott classes in Dharwad
content: Citing lack of adequate number of guest lecturers, students of Government First Grade College and Government First Grade College for Women boycotted clasess in Dharwad on Saturday to register their protest.

title: What caused Karur stampede? Panic after Vijay sang song calling V Senthilbalaji ‘10-rupee minister’
content: A stampede at actor-turned-politician Vijay's rally in Karur, Tamil Nadu, tragically killed 39 people, including children and women, and injured 81. Varying accounts describe the trigger, leading Chief Minister M K Stalin to order an inquiry and ex-gratia payments. Local traders announced a district-wide shutdown in response.

title: 'We need to fix India': Trump aide urges New Delhi to 'avoid policies that harm US'
content: Donald Trump's commerce secretary, Howard Lutnick, stated India must "react correctly" to the US, demanding open markets and an end to policies harming American interests. He grouped India with other nations needing "fixing," asserting that access to US consumers requires "playing ball" with the US president.

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM Modi praises RSS; urges Khadi push on Gandhi Jayanti
content: Prime Minister Modi used his Mann Ki Baat address to praise the RSS ahead of its 100th anniversary, highlighting its service and discipline. He also encouraged Khadi purchases and announced efforts to get Chhath Puja recognized by UNESCO, reflecting India's culture. Modi further paid tribute to Bhagat Singh and Lata Mangeshkar.

title: Empty UN: Bibi delivers speech as dozens of nations walkout
content: Israeli PM Netanyahu, in a defiant UN address, defended his nation's actions and pledged to "finish the job" against Hamas. He sharply criticised US allies for recognising a Palestinian state, labelling it a reward for terrorism and asserting Israel's refusal to accept a "terrorist state." Amid delegate walkouts, Netanyahu accused leaders of succumbing to pressure, while privately acknowledging Israel's intelligence.

title: Accenture CEO on US’ H-1B visa policy: $100K fees non issue; India workforce key
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, stating it poses minimal threat due to the company's low reliance on the program. Sweet views the policy change as a business opportunity, anticipating increased client demand for compliance navigation. This perspective follows Accenture's strong fourth-quarter financial results.

title: How India vs Pak has seen drama in last fortnight - on and off the field
content: The Asia Cup witnessed an intense India-Pakistan cricket rivalry, marked by dramatic matches and significant off-field controversies. India secured victories in both group and Super 4s stages, leading to their historic first-ever final clash. Disputes included India's "no-handshake" policy, political dedications, and controversial gestures by Pakistani players, resulting in fines and protests.

title: Bhopal: Lawyer booked for molesting, stalking woman in court
content: MP Nagar police booked lawyer Aslam Ali for allegedly molesting and stalking a 22-year-old woman inside the district court premises. Ali reportedly approached her, asked personal questions, and inappropriately touched her after she declined his advances. Advocates accompanied the woman to lodge a complaint, and an investigation is underway.

title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman in UAE; meets UAE PM, discusses AI growth opportunities
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman met UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan to bolster AI cooperation. The UAE is aggressively building a knowledge-based AI economy, aiming to reduce oil dependence and enhance global standing. Altman received an honorary doctorate from MBZUAI, highlighting his influence.

title: North Carolina shooting: Passing boat opens fire at Southport eatery; 3 dead
content: Three people were killed and eight injured after a shooter opened fire from a passing boat at the American Fish Company restaurant in Southport, North Carolina, on Saturday night. The unidentified vessel fired into a crowd of diners before fleeing the scene. Authorities are questioning one person of interest as the investigation continues into the deadly incident.

title: Delhi 'godman' Swami Chaitanyananda, accused of molesting female students, arrested from Agra
content: Delhi Police arrested self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati in Agra, accused of sexually harassing 17 women students and orchestrating financial fraud. The 62-year-old allegedly exploited economically weaker students by seizing their phones and certificates, creating fear. His bail plea was rejected, with a court noting custodial interrogation is vital to unravel the extensive fraud and intimidation pattern.

title: H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
content: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded in Dallas: NRGs raise $431k for family
content: Chandra Mouli 'Bob' Nagamallaiah, who migrated to the US with dreams of a hospitality future for his son, was brutally murdered in Dallas. Following his death, the Gujarati community and AAHOA launched a massive fundraising effort, collecting over $431,000 and pledging to fund his son Gaurav's education, ensuring his father's dream lives on.

title: Security tightened at Vijay’s home after Karur stampede
content: Security was tightened at actor and TVK leader Vijay’s Neelankarai residence following the Karur rally stampede that killed 39 and injured over 100. Chennai police and CRPF were deployed, barricades set up, and vehicles checked. Vijay, receiving ‘Y’ category security, faces heightened protection amid political tours and public attention.

title: 4 brothers among 8 get life for throwing man off terrace on Holi
content: Eight men, including four brothers, have been sentenced to life imprisonment for the 2023 murder of a 30-year-old farmer in Aligarh. The violent incident, which occurred during Holi celebrations, stemmed from a minor dispute and long-standing family tensions. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 22,000 on each convict.

title: ‘It was like a human flood’: Survivors recall horror of Vijay rally stampede in Karur
content: A stampede at a TVK rally in Karur was intensified by blocked escape routes due to hoardings and ropes, which also fell and injured attendees. An unexpectedly large crowd, including people from distant districts, led to chaos, trapping many and causing fatalities. The situation worsened when a bakery roof, used for rescue, collapsed.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy showers lash parts of city; traffic disrupted, roads waterlogged
content: Mumbai experienced heavy overnight showers, leading to significant rainfall and widespread waterlogging, notably in the Andheri subway. Airlines like SpiceJet and IndiGo issued advisories, warning passengers of traffic congestion affecting airport travel. The rain is expected to intensify further, likely causing more disruptions to traffic and local train services.

title: Netanyahu faces tough test after Trump's 21-point peace plan — Will he bend or break?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faces a US-backed plan demanding "painful" concessions for post-war Gaza, including a central role for the Palestinian Authority. This directly opposes Netanyahu's repeated insistence on Israeli security control. The plan, revealed by Israeli media, envisions gradual PA governance and a path to Palestinian statehood, while barring Hamas. US officials are pressuring Qatar to secure Hamas's acceptance.

title: 'Maruti moment': India aims for domestic shipbuilding wave
content: India launched a Rs 70,000-crore package to revolutionize its shipbuilding sector, aiming for a "Maruti moment." This initiative seeks to reduce reliance on foreign vessels, which handle 95% of trade, by boosting domestic capacity and attracting major Korean and Japanese shipbuilders. The plan includes incentives and a development fund to strengthen India's maritime security and economic resilience.

title: ‘War against civilians’: Ukraine hit by ‘hundreds’ of Russian drones, missiles overnight
content: Russia launched a massive overnight drone and missile attack on Ukraine, wounding at least 10 and damaging residential buildings. This prompted Poland to scramble fighter jets due to airspace concerns. Ukrainian officials condemned the "war against civilians" and called for stronger sanctions, as Kyiv also confirmed receiving a Patriot air defense system from Israel.

title: Sanjeev Sanyal: H-1B helps America, not India; time to reskill at home
content: Economist Sanjeev Sanyal argues that H-1B visas primarily benefit the United States, not India, as they strengthen American tech firms while draining Indian negotiation leverage. Reacting to Trump’s $100,000 H-1B fee hike, Sanyal urged India to focus on domestic reforms, skills, and returning talent rather than bargaining for visas, highlighting the long-term advantage lies with host nations.

title: Karur stampede: Photos capture panic at Vijay’s rally; 2km stretch packed with crowd
content: A stampede at actor-turned-politician Vijay's rally in Karur, Tamil Nadu, killed 39 people, including 10 children and 17 women, and injured 81. The tragedy occurred Saturday night amidst a massive crowd, with panic ensuing after disturbances and floodlight failures. An inquiry commission has been ordered, and ex-gratia payments announced.

title: 'What’s the coach doing?': Former India star slams team’s poor fielding
content: India's fielding performance is under intense scrutiny ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan, with a concerning 67.5% catching efficiency and 12 dropped catches. Former spinner Amit Mishra criticized the team's consistent errors, while Varun Chakravarthy mentioned Dubai's 'Ring of Fire' lights as a challenge.

title: 'Interest gone up since revisions': Trump's 'Gold Card' draws rise in Indians chasing American dream
content: Donald Trump's new Gold Card program, offering fast-track US residency for a $1 million "gift," is sparking significant interest among Indians, especially after H-1B visa fees soared to $100,000. Immigration firms report a sharp rise in queries from tech professionals, though some lawyers note muted interest due to the substantial investment.

title: ‘Never happened before in TN’: EPS slams DMK, police
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami strongly questioned the police and state government's role after a deadly stampede claimed 39 lives at actor Vijay's TVK event. Palaniswami alleged inadequate and biased security, criticizing organizers for safety lapses. He expressed skepticism over the official inquiry, highlighting doubts and calling the incident unprecedented in Tamil Nadu's political campaign history, demanding accountability.

title: 'President is prepared': Is US plotting more strikes in Venezuela?
content: US military officials are planning potential drone strikes against drug traffickers and labs in Venezuela, possibly starting in weeks, though President Trump has not yet approved. This escalation follows recent strikes on suspected narcotics boats and reflects Washington's frustration with Maduro's government over drug flows.

title: Robbery at Mary Kom’s Faridabad house: Burglars loot taps, inverter battery
content: Olympic medalist Mary Kom's locked home in Surajkund was burgled earlier this week, with thieves accessing it through a vacant plot and a broken terrace window. Police confirmed gold items, taps, and an inverter battery are missing. An investigation is underway, but a formal complaint is awaited from Kom, who is currently out of station.

title: Kanpur: 15-year-old boy killed in wedding dispute over chicken piece
content: A 15-year-old boy was bludgeoned to death at a wedding feast in Kannauj after defending his grandfather, who was humiliated for requesting a chicken leg piece. The accused and his four brothers attacked the boy with bricks, causing fatal injuries.

title: Ahmedabad: 19-year-old pregnant woman dies by suicide over dowry harassment
content: A 19-year-old pregnant woman died by suicide in Ahmedabad, prompting her father to accuse her husband and in-laws of abetment. He alleged persistent dowry demands, including an additional Rs 50,000, and verbal abuse, along with humiliation regarding her pregnancy. Police registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway into the tragic incident.

title: Trump slaps $100K H-1B fee; Canada eyes Indian talent; Carney spots opening
content: Canada is seizing a major opportunity as the US imposes a steep $100,000 H-1B visa fee under Trump. Prime Minister Mark Carney has pledged new measures to attract skilled Indian workers priced out of the US. With Europe also competing, Canada’s large Indian diaspora and clear pathways to citizenship make it an increasingly attractive destination for global talent.

title: 'Lata Mangeshkar is India’s greatest musical personality of last century'
content: A new book, "Lata Mangeshkar: My Favourites, Vol 2," delves into the legendary singer's personal song selections, revealing her often arbitrary yet diverse taste across her decades-long career. Authors Anirudha Bhattacharjee and Chandrashekar Rao discuss her choices and share fascinating anecdotes, underscoring her colossal and unparalleled contribution to Indian popular music.

title: The mood changed in minutes in Karur: Cheering Vijay supporters left mourning; 39 dead
content: Karur was rocked by a tragic stampede Saturday night, killing 38 people, including women and children, and leaving families inconsolable. The overwhelmed Karur GH is receiving support from special medical teams and 100 ambulances. Police had earlier suggested an alternative, safer venue for the campaign where the incident occurred.

title: UP dad strangles 14-year-old daughter for ‘stealing’ Rs 500; body dumped in canal
content: A 40-year-old man was arrested in Meerut for allegedly strangling his 14-year-old daughter and dumping her body in a canal. He confessed to the crime, stating he was angered by her taking Rs 500 without permission, which he considered 'stealing'. The girl's mother revealed her husband misled her about their daughter's whereabouts and later threatened her.

title: BMW accident: CCTV footage helps main accused Gaganpreet Makkad get bail
content: Gaganpreet Makkad, accused in a fatal BMW accident, received bail after CCTV footage challenged the prosecution's direct ramming claim. The court noted the car lost control and flipped, suggesting rash driving. It also criticized a DTC bus, ambulance driver, and paramedic for their unprofessional conduct at the scene.

title: Asia Cup: 'Jab tak jung hai tab tak cricket ki rivalry rahegi' - Former Pak captain
content: Rashid Latif reignited the India-Pakistan rivalry debate ahead of the Asia Cup final, saying it will never end “as long as there is war.” While admitting India has the edge in skills, Latif stressed that the pressure will always be on India, who have “everything to lose,” while Pakistan, as underdogs, enter the contest with nothing to lose.

title: Bengaluru: Neighbour, friend stab 4 of family for questioning their reckless driving
content: Two men stabbed four family members in Bengaluru on September 24 after being confronted about reckless driving and parking. Venkatesh and his friend attacked Ramesh, Hanumanthamma, Hemanth, and Pavan, leaving them injured. All victims are now recovering in the hospital, and Venkatesh has been arrested for attempted murder.

title: Sanju Samson on the verge of history; has multiple records in sight during Asia Cup final
content: Sanju Samson is quietly building a strong case to become India's greatest T20I wicketkeeper-batter in multi-nation tournaments. With 108 runs in the Asia Cup, he needs just 64 more in the final to surpass Rishabh Pant's record. Samson has also become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in sixes, showcasing his destructive ability and adaptability across batting positions.

title: Georgia vs Alabama fans erupt in chaotic brawl at Sanford Stadium
content: A fierce college football rivalry between Georgia and Alabama erupted into a massive fan brawl at Sanford Stadium following Alabama's narrow 24-21 victory. Tensions, fueled by a controversial referee call, escalated from verbal jabs to swinging fists, requiring security intervention. This chaotic incident, widely discussed on social media, starkly highlighted how intense sports passion can dangerously spill beyond the field.

title: ‘Bharat will maintain its freedom of choice’: Jaishankar takes swipe at US, China
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar criticized growing trade protectionism and coercive supply chain practices by major global powers, implicitly targeting the US and China. He warned these actions erode trust and disproportionately hurt the Global South, citing US tariffs on Indian exports and Trump's pharma relocation demands. Jaishankar urged the Global South to resist such trends.

title: Army issues tender for highly mobile air defence system
content: India has initiated the acquisition process for three regiments of indigenous "Anant Shastra" Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missile systems, costing Rs 30,000 crore. These highly mobile systems, developed by DRDO, will detect and destroy aerial threats over 30km, providing crucial air defence cover for troops and replacing older systems, especially after recent border hostilities.

title: For decades now, major international attacks traced to Pakistan: EAM Jaishankar
content: India's Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar warned the UN against nations sponsoring terror, implicitly calling Pakistan a global terrorism epicentre. India's representative further lambasted Pakistan, citing its history of sheltering terrorists and sponsoring groups like 'The Resistance Front' responsible for attacks. New Delhi asserted accountability for terrorists and their sponsors, rejecting third-party mediation.

title: Karur stampede: Crowd swelled with no food, water due to Vijay’s delayed arrival
content: Tamil Nadu DGP G Venkataraman explained the Karur rally stampede. He cited actor-politician Vijay's delayed arrival as the cause. A large crowd waited hours in the sun without food or water. Vijay's party Twitter handle announced an earlier arrival time. This led to an unexpected surge of nearly 27,000 people. Police deployment was for 20,000, not the actual turnout.

title: 'Standing here with deep sorrow': Tamil Nadu CM Stalin meets Karur stampede families; toll rises to 39
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin visited Karur following a stampede at a TVK campaign event, which tragically killed 39 people and injured many. He announced Rs 10 lakh compensation for the deceased and Rs 1 lakh for the injured. A retired High Court judge will head an inquiry commission into the incident.

title: 'Snapback' over nuclear programme: UN hits Iran with sanctions
content: The UN has reimposed wide-ranging sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program, triggered by European powers due to Iran's uranium enrichment and non-compliance. This has led to severe economic hardship, including currency collapse and soaring food prices, while fears of renewed conflict with Israel and the US loom. Diplomacy remains uncertain amid intensifying internal repression.

title: Evans steals the show; Vaquer-Stratton set for Crown Jewel
content: "SmackDown" set up a major match for the crown jewel event in Perth, Australia . Tiffany Stratton retained her WWE Women's Championship on Friday . the story of Friday night was a save, surprise and an incredible showing by one of the most talented wrestlers in the roster .

content: the "NBA Today" crew discusses a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . our 2025 NBA Rank wraps up as we break down the final top 10 players in the league . we asked our expert panel to vote on player vs. player matchups .

title: NBA Rank 2025: What league insiders say about the top 100
content: a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . we reached out to scouts, coaches and executives across the league to get their feedback on our new top 100 for 2025-26 . some of the biggest questions and points of contention from our latest edition of NBA Rank .

title: How will the Giants' offense run with Jaxson Dart under center?
content: the new york Giants have two different versions of the offense this summer and at training camp . the rookie quarterback is the 25th pick in this year's draft . it's his first career start against the los Angeles Chargers at MetLife Stadium .

title: Inside the secret ingredient fueling the NFL's most decorated defensive coordinator
content: the "Get Up" crew debates which team, the Ravens or the Chiefs, is under pressure to win . players laughed when they saw grainy footage of defensive line coach Joe Cullen as a nose tackle . "it's in black and white," linebacker leo Chenal says .

title: 'That's Guard ball': Inside the chaotic approach that has fueled the Guardians' epic rise
content: the inning came in the bottom of the sixth in the opening game of a crucial series between the Cleveland Guardians and Detroit Tigers . the two rivals had been going in opposite directions for the better part of the month . all-world pitcher Tarik Skubal was nursing a 2-0 lead, meaning the end of the Tigers were just a few innings away .

title: Buzz: Xavier Worthy, Brock Purdy expected to return Sunday
content: fantasy football buzz aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . it took only three snaps on the field for Worthy to collide with teammate Travis Kelce . despite coach Andy Reid's "day by day" optimism, it turned out to be a week-to-week process .

title: Arizona State, West Virginia lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: the sun Devils are going with a sleek look to match a home crowd that has been asked to wear black . it's a black helmet, jersey and pants for the school . the school's usual shade of yellow serves as a secondary color for the look .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 4
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . this guide should help you with all sorts of decisions, including sit/start, last-minute waiver adds and lineup choices .

title: Struggling Brentford deepen Amorim's Man United malaise
content: man united lose 3-1 to Brentford at the emirates stadium on saturday . Nicol believes he's still the right man to take this team forward . the portuguese coach has been in charge for 11 months . it would have been more had it not been for a string of saves .

title: 15 more Week 4 games, 15 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: the "Get Up" crew debates which team, the Ravens or the Chiefs, is under pressure to get a win ahead of their game Sunday . quarterback quarterback Jaxson Dart will make his debut against the surging Chargers . the 1-2 teams will face off in an AFC showdown .

title: ⚾ MLB playoff tracker: What's still at stake?
content: the final day of the regular season is going to be wild . will the New York Mets or Cincinnati Reds win the final wild-card spot in the national league? will the Toronto Blue Jays or New York Yankees earn a first-round bye (and the AL's top seed) by winning the American League East?

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 5: How big was the bump for Oregon, Bama?
content: the team's head-to-head tiebreaker is factoring into the ranking . it's one of several tiebreakers it uses when comparing teams . the selection committee doesn't release its first ranking until Nov. 4 .
